name: templates/etl
description: Download a data file, upload it to a database, process it, and plot with Python and R.

description: Sample pipeline that explores penguins data.

name: templates/google-cloud
description: Use Google Cloud and Ploomber to develop a scalable and production-ready pipeline.

name: templates/ml-advanced
description: ML pipeline using the Python API. Shows how to create a Python package, test it with pytest, and train models in parallel.

description: Download data, clean it, generate features and train a model.

name: templates/ml-intermediate
description: Training and serving ML pipelines with integration testing to evaluate training data quality.

name: templates/ml-online
description: Load data, generate features, train a model, and deploy model with flask.

name: templates/mlflow
description: Train a grid of models and log them to MLflow.

name: templates/python-api
description: Loads, clean, and plot data using the Python API.

name: templates/pytorch
description: Using GPUs to train models in Ploomber Cloud.

name: templates/shell
description: Create a pipeline with shell scripts as tasks.

name: templates/spec-api-directory
description: Create a pipeline from a directory with scripts (without a pipeline.yaml file).

name: templates/spec-api-r
description: Load, clean and plot data with R.

name: templates/spec-api-sql
description: Use SQL scripts to manipulate data in a database, dump a table, and plot it with Python.

name: cookbook/dynamic-params
description: Pipeline parameters whose values are computed at runtime.

name: cookbook/file-client
description: Upload task's products upon execution (local, S3, GCloud storage)

name: cookbook/grid
description: An example showing how to create a grid of tasks to train models with different parameters.

name: cookbook/hooks
description: Task hooks

name: cookbook/nested-cv
description: Nested cross-validation for model selection and hyperparameter tuning.

name: cookbook/python-load
description: Load pipeline.yaml file in a Python session to customize initialization.

name: cookbook/report-generation
description: Generating HTML/PDF reports.

name: cookbook/serialization
description: Shows how to use the serializer and unserializer decorators.

name: cookbook/sql-dump
description: A minimal example showing how to dump a table from a SQL database.

name: cookbook/variable-number-of-products
description: Shows how to create tasks whose number of products depends on runtime conditions.

name: guides/cron
description: This guide shows how to schedule Ploomber pipelines using cron.

name: guides/debugging
description: Tutorial showing techniques for debugging pipelines.

name: guides/first-pipeline
description: Introductory tutorial to learn the basics of Ploomber.

name: guides/logging
description: Tutorial showing how to add logging to a pipeline.

name: guides/monitoring
description: To show the capabilities we'll run our pipeline monitoring through a pre-built Ploomber template: ml-basic.

name: guides/parametrized
description: Tutorial showing how to parametrize pipelines and change parameters from the command-line.

name: guides/refactor
description: Using Soorgeon to convert a notebook into a Ploomber pipeline.

name: guides/serialization
description: Tutorial explaining how the serializer and unserializer fields in a pipeline.yaml file work.

name: guides/sql-templating
description: Introductory tutorial teaching how to develop modular SQL pipelines.

name: guides/testing
description: Tutorial showing how to use a task's on_finish hook to test data quality.

name: guides/versioning
description: A tutorial showing how to version pipeline products.

name: guides/airflow
description: A tutorial showing how to expose ploomber pipelines to Airflow.
